H0.text: The types of waves are what the visible light spectrum can be subdivided according to.

H1.text: The sizes of particles are the basis for subdividing the visible light spectrum.

H2.text: A range of colors is how the visible light spectrum can be subdivided.

H3.text: A type of energy is what the visible light spectrum can be subdivided according to.

A4.text: The visible spectrum is defined by a range of wavelengths from 380 to 750 nanometers.

A5.text: Spectral colors are produced by visible light of a narrow band of wavelengths.
